content:
Trackers up for block vote on FHIR-I March 1st, 3-5 PM ET call:
FHIR-30571 2020 Argonaut Workgroup Changes
FHIR-28606 Guidance on coordinating additional query parameters and extensions
FHIR-26683 Poor choice of canonical URI for the Bulk Data CapabilityStatement
FHIR-26651 Is this really a good example for bulk?
FHIR-26367 Distinguish polling request failure from job failure

@Dan Gottlieb @Yunwei Wang
@Dan Gottlieb and @Josh Mandel + I have prepared a block vote Bulk data....but it got large 60+. Do folks mind if we post Monday and allow a full two weeks for review?
FHIR-I will host Block Vote 1 during the Monday 7/12 3-5 PM ET call! Please reply here or to the email list if you prefer to have a comment discussed.

Brett - can you pull FHIR-32183, FHIR-32146, FHIR-32143, FHIR-32140, and FHIR-32137 from block vote.
I've added comments to each of these issues.
Done. Added Discuss grouping and removed from block vote 1. FYI @Dan Gottlieb for 7/12 FHIR-I call

We might want to schedule either

1) a "special session", or
2) a dedicated "back half" of our 2h scheduled weekly call slot

for resolving the Bulk Data issues that require discussion. Preferences?
Either works for me - maybe plan on using the second half of the meeting on Monday to keep things moving?
@FHIR-I Co-chairs what do you think of this?
